The mod_authn_dbd docs claim: "DBD drivers recognise both stdio-like %s and
native syntax".  (This is a comment in the example configuration.)  However,
this is not true; the %letter syntax must be used.  See the documentation for
apr_dbd_prepare() at
http://apr.apache.org/docs/apr-util/trunk/group___a_p_r___util___d_b_d.html#gcf21412447c4357c64d1e9200a0f5eec
or the source at
http://svn.apache.org/viewvc/apr/apr-util/trunk/dbd/apr_dbd.c?revision=564526&view=markup

A link to this documentation of the %letter syntax would be useful.
creator: spam_from_apache_bugzilla@chezphil.org
bit-bucket@gmx.net
text:
Using '?' as a placeholder in 'native syntax' works for me using the DBDrivers
'sqlite3' and 'mysql' with the 2.2.6-Release (bundled with apr-util-1.2.10).

> AuthDBDUserPWQuery "SELECT password FROM authn WHERE username = ?"

BTW: The child seems to segfault if you're using to placeholders (stdio or native).
